task_description: Facing the building to your South-West (approx. 243°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to estimate the height of the building, but I cannot see its top, so I will look up to get a full view of the structure.
My view has incorrectly reset to North; I need to turn back to face the target building which is at approximately 243 degrees.
I am facing the correct building again, but I still can't see the top, so I will tilt my view upwards to see the entire structure.
The heading has reset to North again; I need to rotate back to 243 degrees and also pitch up by 30 degrees to see the top of the building.
I can now see the full height of the building, which appears to have approximately 10 floors; assuming a standard floor height of about 3.5 meters, the total height is around 35 meters.
